title: PhD. Biological Sciences
institution: University of Missouri, Columbia, MO
description_1: Coursework included Machine Learning Methods for Biomedical Informatics, Quantitative Methods in the Life Sciences, and Grant Writing

title: Bachelor of Science
institution: Truman State University, Kirksville, MO
description_1: Coursework included Next Generation Sequence Data and Analysis, Bioinformatics, Analysis of Variance and Experimental Design, Non-Parametric Statistics, and Economic & Medicinal Botany

title: Research Geneticist
institution: Jacob Washburn Lab, USDA-ARS
description_1: Improved yield prediction of maize in diverse environments by using deep learning to better capture gene by environment effects. Conducted research and wrote manuscript on results. Communciated results to stakeholders through local and national presentations. Supervised undergraduate high throughput phenotyping project and assisted with related coding needs.

title: Graduate Student
institution: David Schulz Lab, Missouri State University
description_1: Assessed the efficacy of machine learning models to recapitulate neural cell identity from mRNA expression [1](https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.1911413116). Demonstrated that activity desynchronization induces degree dependent changes in conductance between neurons [2](https://www.jneurosci.org/content/42/35/6751). Investigated the compensatory effects of elevated depolarization on neuronal excitability, conductances, and ion channel mRNA abundances in small neural networks [3](https://mospace.umsystem.edu/xmlui/handle/10355/85790).

title: Graduate Student Rotation
institution: Loren Milescu Lab, Missouri State University
description_1: Developed a protocol for live imaging neurons in Drosophila melanogaster with a two-photon microscope.

title: Graduate Student Rotation
institution: Bing Zhang Lab, Missouri State University
description_1: Designed a machine to assay Drosophila climbing (used in [Willenbrink et al. 2016](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/01677063.2016.1255211)) and quantified sleep patterns of Drosophila tyrosine hydroxylase mutants

title: Undergraduate Researcher
institution: Diane Janick-Buckner, Brent Buckner Lab, Truman State University
description_1: Designed and prototyped a hydroponic growth chamber for maize root phenotyping.

title: NSF REU Student
institution: Rahul Kanadia Lab, University of Conneticut
description_1: Measured minor spliceosome upregulation using in situ hybridization supporting a role in postponing retinal cell death.

title: NSF REU Student
institution: Christian Lorson Lab, Missouri State University
description_1: Assessed motor function in mouse model of spinal muscular atrophy with and without oligonucleotide treatment.

title: Camp Counselor & Lifeguard
description_1: Responsible for safety, development, and wellbeing of campers.

title: Student Assistant
institution: Laszlo Kovacs Laboratory, Missouri State University
description_1: Tested teaching experiments for use in a genetics course.

title: Lead Teaching Assistant, Animal Physiology Lab
institution: Biological Sciences, University of Missouri
description_1: Coordinated adaptation and expansion of lab material to be fully online due to Covid-19. Developed and deployed a statistics web application used by a minimum 705 students as of 2021 [source](https://github.com/danielkick/MultiMethodPhysApp) , [deployed](https://danielkick.shinyapps.io/BioSc3700_1). Includes capability for visualization, testing model assumptions, frequentist models, non-parametric tests, basic Bayesian models. Lead Benton Berigan, Jose Viteri, Josh Lisse, Dr. Michael Gray.

title: Teaching Assistant, Animal Physiology Lab
institution: Biological Sciences, University of Missouri
description_1: Tested additional curriculum alterations, tested grade distrubutions to identify and adjust for grader effects.

title: Curriculum Consultant, Animal Physiology Lab
institution: Biological Sciences, University of Missouri
description_1: Updated curriculum and redesigned experiments placing a greater focus primary literature and data analysis.

title: Teaching Assistant, Animal Physiology Lab
institution: Biological Sciences, University of Missouri
description_1: Provided weekly lectures on relevant background, ensured experiments were conducted safely, provided timely feedback on assignments.

title: Mentoring Undergraduate Researchers
institution: As a **Postdoc: Supervised 2 students** conducting a highthroughput root phenotyping experiment: Grace Sidberry (2021-pres.),  Madi Michell (2022-pres.). Abby Beckerdite (2016-2019), Ayla Ross (2019), Katlyn Sullivan (2018), Kelly Hiersche (2017), & Rody Kingston (2016)
